timeline.bodyText: if these are public maybe we should move them to some more descriptive class name. Like Messages or something like that?
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: Do you think a Metadata interface would be better? I thought putting these constants in the "owner" visitors or in the common ancestor if they are shared.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: Metadata interface/util class would be perfect!
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: could it be mis-read? I was thinking this was pointing to the "parent" of this node (i.e. another node).
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: I renamed it because some nodes have their own nodeContainer. Besides, whenever this method is used is assigned to a variable called parent and the attribute returned is parentNodeContainer.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: Hmm, if some nodes have their own nodeContainer, then getNodeContainer() should return "their own nodeContainer" or not?
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Only CompositeNode has its own nodeContainer? I mean it seems it is returning itself.
Why not just overriding the original getNodeContainer on  CompositeNode, or whatever node that has a different behavior other than returning the parent.
replies.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see now. CompositeNode has another NodeContainer named nodeContainer but this, until now, wasn't returned by any of the CompositeNode methods. So by calling getNodeContainer() the NodeContainer from the NodeImpl parent was returned and there was no option to obtain the NodeContainer of CompositeNode using a getter. Now, the getParentContainer() will return the one-level-above container (the one from NodeImpl) and getNodeContainer() will return the one from CompositeNode. In practice, these nodes can be nested into each other many times, but now it is possible to obtain just the container with nodes inside ("belonging to") the CompositeNode and the container which CompositeNode is in separately.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText:
Hmm, it seems you swapped these 2 tests :)
Here the name of the test is time cycle but you are setting time duration and vice versa.
timeline.author: MarianMacik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -116,7 +118,11 @@ public void testBoundaryTimerTimeCycle() throws Exception {
                 .startNode(1).name("Start").done()
                 .humanTaskNode(2).name("Task").actorId("john").taskName("MyTask").done()
                 .endNode(3).name("End1").terminate(false).done()
-                .boundaryEventNode(4).name("BoundaryTimerEvent").attachedTo(2).timeCycle("1s###5s").cancelActivity(false).done()
+                .boundaryEventNode(4).name("BoundaryTimerEvent").attachedTo(2)
+                    .metaData(BoundaryEventNodeFactory.METADATA_TIME_DURATION, duration)

timeline.bodyText: Here's the second test.
timeline.author: MarianMacik
timeline.diffHunk:

                 .startNode(1).name("Start").done()
                 .humanTaskNode(2).name("Task").actorId("john").taskName("MyTask").done()
                 .endNode(3).name("End1").terminate(false).done()
-                .boundaryEventNode(4).name("BoundaryTimerEvent").attachedTo(2).timeDuration("1s").cancelActivity(false).done()
+                .boundaryEventNode(4)
+                    .name("BoundaryTimerEvent")
+                    .attachedTo(2)
+                    .metaData(BoundaryEventNodeFactory.METADATA_TIME_CYCLE, timeCycle)

timeline.bodyText: Why where these helper methods removed? Or did you want to make the setup more explicit?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: The main reason is that Metadata attributes are copied in the VisitMetadata method so this seems redundant.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: I see, so eventTypes and metaData are "copied" when bpmn is traversed anyway.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: Hmm, what about calling it getParentNodeContainer()? This way it will be consistent, i.e. getNodeContainer() for getting this node's container and getParentNodeContainer() for getting the node container of this node parent :) Wdyt?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: What about just getContainer and getParentContainer ? FYI not all nodes have their own container, only CompositeNode nodes have it.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: Yes, +1.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: So in this case the actionType key is not present in a map? In this case we should probably assert for null in the previous if condition, right?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: As discussed, this is ok.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: just a formatting comment, it would be great to break all chained method calls into different lines.

timeline.bodyText: why not passing the function,body::addStatement  as a parameter to the visitCustomFields method and apply it on the method implementation, I mean to keep the same approach of other visit methods, or just change the method name to getCustomFields ?
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: Probably the best option would be to pass body as another argument as with other visitors.
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
why not passing the function,body::addStatement as a parameter to the visitCustomFields method and apply it on the method implementation, I mean to keep the same approach of other visit methods, or just change the method name to getCustomFields ?

That will make it look very different from the other visit methods.

Probably the best option would be to pass body as another argument as with other visitors.

I wanted to avoid passing an object to be modified as an argument. This is part of some refactoring I did everywhere that didn't require too big changes, like in visitNodes.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: isn't safer to check if node is instance of DynamicNode? Or maybe better to use Generics on AbstractNodeVisitor, to avoid the need for casting.
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: I have refactored all the visitor classes to make them use generics, I think they look much better. Thanks for the suggestion.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: same here, check before casting, or better to use generics.
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText: same here, to avoid the cast it could be used generics, maybe on AbstractNodeVisitor
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText: why the static final was removed? Anyway, if it is not a constant anymore you can change the name to camel case.
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: On interfaces, every field is defined as static final and public so this is redundant.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: ooh this is an interface, yep you are right!
replies.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText:
Generics now works but just because here we use unsafe casting. Without it the types in the call on line 44 visitor.visitNode(factoryField, node, body, variableScope, metadata); wouldn't match as U[] nodes is always array of Node (passed from the visitNode method) so U is Node but then we are passing this node variable of type Node to that method call on line 44. But given we did unsafe casting here, compiler is happy and it is ok after type erasure as during runtime the signature of abstractNodeVisitor visitNode() method has Node.
In short, I am not sure if this helped the hierarchy :) We also use raw types for Visitors in ProcessVisitor.java file.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText:
Here we are using raw types for example.
Same issue with unsafe calls now appeared in visitNodes method as well.
timeline.author: MarianMacik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,6 +105,9 @@ public ProcessVisitor(ClassLoader contextClassLoader) {
         this.nodesVisitors.put(CompositeContextNode.class, new CompositeContextNodeVisitor(nodesVisitors));

timeline.bodyText: @ruromero not sure we should introduce a new extension. Should these just be as regular .bpmn or .bpmn2 ?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: bpmn-cm is a format introduced in jbpm7 for case modeler. It is compatible with bpmn2 and as we are adding functionalities for case management processes I think it's nice to have. Otherwise, processes created with the case modeler jbpm7.x will have to be renamed to work on Kogito.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: @ruromero you do have a point but I believe that it should be discussed with the team to understand our overall strategy around it. At least to me, it is not clear if we want to promote that with Kogito.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: np to leave it then
